ygData.subject: Re: ___JBoots___ and Anticamping coding
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I read an article which sounds similar to the one you say you read and I believe it was Brad himself that was quoted as saying no anti-camping zones . But
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "IDS" <ids@...>
>
>I read a Q&A with either Brad McQuaid or John Smedley on EQVault, >probably
>Brad. He was asked about anti-camp zones specificaly and he >said that
>while they were thinking about it or testing it in beta >they did not
>implement any anti-camp code.

>My take on all this is just crappy randomness in the game. Multiple
> >fizzles and resists are more common than isolated or alternating >ones,
>the best chance to get a rare loot, if you were betting on it, >is on the
>very next spawn than some random numbe of spawns.
>
>I don't camp all that much but so far I've seen that if say the mean >item
>drop time is 8 hours what really happens is the item might be >dropped 2-3
>times in rapid succession within 4 hours (rapid?) then >nothing for 20-24
>hours. This is for relatively normal item not the >super rare items like
>the GBS.
>
>What I have seen:
>
>Tae Templar not spawn for 2 day, throne room was being cleared all >the
>time. next day my friends got 3 rubi legs in 3 consecutive >spawns.
>
>AoF spawning infrequently and dropping only 1 tunic in about 12 hours >then
>back to back AoF within 20 min and both dropping tunics. During the same
>time the Cenobyte spawns pretty regularly for 3 days straight but never a
>pair of boots on him.
>
>BUT these and your observations are pure speculation you have to >spend a
>statistically significant time observing a spawn and need to >know the
>spawn rules for that specific mob that verant has put in to >tell if either
>there is anti-camp code (no there isn't) or if their >random number
>generator is flawed (yes it is). I have no desire to do >that.
>

I read an article which sounds similar to the one you say you read and I
believe it was Brad himself that was quoted as saying "no anti-camping
zones". But that article was released at least a month ago, (maybe longer)
and camping has become a major issue since then - hence all the changes
(lore items implemented; no drops more common; unbelievably slow/long spawn
rates for rares; changing respawn rates).

As for my pure speculation, I spent over 2 weeks (hours upon hours)
timing/camping various spawns throughout Befallen to test my theory. I even
had other players helping me out. According to what I found, in certain
areas, not all areas mind you, there's an anti-camping code. If you wish to
not believe, then so be it. But in my experience, they exist. I only wish I
had screenshots of the GM's and Guides I've talked to who said there was to
back up what I'm saying. I'd gladly send the screenshots to all who doubt.
